sourceMeaningMnemonic: <radical>Rain</radical> falls off a <radical>tree</radical> and lands in your <radical>eye</radical> where it turns to <kanji>frost</kanji>. It turns to frost because it’s super cold outside and your body is freezing. The rain that fell off the tree turns to frost as soon as it hits your eye.
meaningInfo: Feel the rain hit your eye and then crystalize into frost immediately. The rain in your eye is wet, and then very cold as it becomes frost.
readingMnemonic: This whole description is pretty emo. You came up with this whole emo <kanji>frost</kanji> idea because you are a <reading>shemo</reading> (<ja>しも</ja>). An emo who goes by she pronouns.
readingInfo: Picture yourself walking proudly, casting your frost gaze at all who you pass. "Wow look at that frosty, cool shemo. She's sooooo cool!" you hear them whisper. (Haha cool, get it? Because you're frosty and also a little sad, which is totally in when you're a teen.)
